allow:
Bash(# First activate Simulator
osascript -e ''tell application ""Simulator"" to activate''
sleep 1

# Use AppleScript to click on the email field and type
osascript <<'EOF'
tell application "System Events"
    tell process "Simulator"
        -- Click on the email text field \(approximate position\)
        click at {410, 520}
        delay 0.5
    end tell
end tell
EOF

sleep 0.5
echo ""Clicked on email field"")

Bash(# Use AppleScript to toggle software keyboard and interact with Simulator
osascript <<'EOF'
tell application "Simulator"
    activate
end tell

delay 0.5

tell application "System Events"
    tell process "Simulator"
        -- Toggle software keyboard via menu
        click menu item "Toggle Software Keyboard" of menu "Keyboard" of menu item "Keyboard" of menu "I/O" of menu bar 1
    end tell
end tell
EOF

sleep 1
echo ""Toggled software keyboard"")

Bash(# Click on the email field using Simulator coordinates
osascript <<'EOF'
tell application "Simulator"
    activate
end tell

delay 0.3

tell application "System Events"
    tell process "Simulator"
        -- Get window position and size
        set winPos to position of window 1
        set winSize to size of window 1
        
        -- The email field is roughly at 50% width, about 40% from top
        set clickX to \(item 1 of winPos\) + \(\(item 1 of winSize\) * 0.5\)
        set clickY to \(item 2 of winPos\) + \(\(item 2 of winSize\) * 0.42\)
        
        -- Click at the calculated position
        click at {clickX, clickY}
    end tell
end tell
EOF

sleep 0.5

# Take screenshot to verify
xcrun simctl io ""89CF5222-7ECB-4D88-9523-E2E283AB7848"" screenshot ""/Users/khaleelal-mulla/General/ Projects/Tclients/Screenshots/after_click2.png""
echo ""Clicked on email field"")

Bash(# Use AppleScript with more precise clicking and keyboard input
osascript <<'EOF'
tell application "Simulator"
    activate
end tell

delay 0.5

tell application "System Events"
    tell process "Simulator"
        set frontmost to true
        delay 0.3
        
        -- Click in the middle of the window where the text field should be
        set theWindow to window 1
        set {x, y, w, h} to {0, 0, 0, 0}
        set {x, y} to position of theWindow
        set {w, h} to size of theWindow
        
        -- Log the window dimensions
        log "Window position: " & x & ", " & y
        log "Window size: " & w & ", " & h
        
        -- Click on email field \(estimated at roughly 50% across, 38% down\)
        set clickX to x + \(w * 0.5\)
        set clickY to y + \(h * 0.38\)
        
        log "Clicking at: " & clickX & ", " & clickY
        
        click at {clickX, clickY}
        delay 0.3
        
        -- Now type the email using keystroke
        keystroke "demo@tsh.sale"
        delay 0.3
    end tell
end tell
EOF

sleep 1

# Take screenshot
xcrun simctl io ""89CF5222-7ECB-4D88-9523-E2E283AB7848"" screenshot ""/Users/khaleelal-mulla/General/ Projects/Tclients/Screenshots/after_type.png""
echo ""Typed email"")

Bash(# Copy email to simulator pasteboard and try pasting
echo -n ""demo@tsh.sale"" | pbcopy

# Now use AppleScript to paste
osascript <<'EOF'
tell application "Simulator"
    activate
end tell

delay 0.3

tell application "System Events"
    tell process "Simulator"
        -- First, let's click directly on the simulator window content
        -- by clicking on coordinates inside the device screen area
        
        set frontmost to true
        delay 0.2
        
        -- Press Command+V to paste \(in case field is focused\)
        keystroke "v" using command down
    end tell
end tell
EOF

sleep 0.5
xcrun simctl io ""89CF5222-7ECB-4D88-9523-E2E283AB7848"" screenshot ""/Users/khaleelal-mulla/General/ Projects/Tclients/Screenshots/after_paste.png""
echo ""Attempted paste"")
